title.narrative: Susamati gap funding: starting the toilet business in Maputo, Mozambique

description.narrative: At the start of the project, Susamati existed for several months, had 14 molds and a production workshop. It had been awarded for funding from the Islamic Development Bank, but the first instalments were delayed.

Specific goals for this funding are:
1. Continuation of the business of this start-up
2. Development of strategies for marketing and scaling
3. At least 2 main contracts secured

Susamati was created after the completion of the Aqua for All supported practical research project aiming at the introduction of the Black Soldier Fly as a means to reduce the volume of sludge in latrine pits. The research project had developed three business lines: the biobased pit latrine, Black Soldier Fly production and the Pia Fantastica, a very low flush toilet that was meant to be combined with the bio-based pit. Only the Pia Fantastica was business ready. Specifics are the straight flush pipe, the low water use, the ease of local production (concrete in a mold and painting), the attractiveness of the design and the competative price compared to industrial flush toilets. Marketing of toilets is, however, not a simple business as many toilet manufacturers have gone bankrupt, already.

Susamati was created in 2019 as a company that aims at low cost and water-saving sanitation technology. The main product is the Pia Fantastica, a toilet that needs very little water to flush. Next to that, the company is continuing the development of other business lines that include the black soldier fly larvae products, consultancies and training. As a starting company, Susamati requested gap funding from Aqua for All to sustain itself during the first year of operation and strengthen its business.

The gap funding is to support the further implementation of the business plan. Specific deliverables are testing different marketing strategies and business concepts (franchise) while developing business lines for training, consultancies and larger works (such as public toilet buildings).

The main target group for the Pia Fantastica are people living in Low Income areas without a sewer system. The price of 800 Mt (about € 11) is affordable for people living at the base of the pyramid.
Susamati aims to scale through production workshops that work on franchise basis. Preference is given to women groups. Sales will be done through existing sales outlets of hardware.

title.narrative: 5- Local partners and targeted groups build capacity in wash business development, technical knowledge, life skills and partnerships for local businesses.

description.narrative: Total number of people reached with capacity building, training and learning events, disaggregated by gender and by type of event

title.narrative: 2- Increased employment opportunities for local community
2.1-Number of people that have a paid position or have become self employed (e.g entrepeneurs) as a result of the initiative.

description.narrative:
Total nr of individuals that have gained a position as a result of initiative at this time of measurement . Disaggregate by number of new jobs created and number of entrepreneurs/self-employed positions. Disaggregate by male/female.
\*\* Minimum requirement to the reporting indicator should follow National standards on daily wages and working conditions (Max 8 hours per day and max 6 days a week)

title.narrative: 1- Improved access to safe water, sanitation and IWRM services/products
1 - Total number of people reached with safe Water, sanitation and IWRM services/products

description.narrative: Fill in the total number of people reached with your initiative at this exact time of measurement (beneficiaries, customers, users etc) with all of the Water, sanitation and IWRM activities. number of users (Aggregate nr of beneficiaries under drinking water, sanitation and IWRM and Capacity building)

comment.narrative: Baseline data collected at project level

title.narrative: S1- Total number of current unique users served by the initiative with access to improved and safe sanitation products and services

description.narrative:
Fill in total number of unique current users for sanitation. Disaggregated per: Male/Female. Type: Domestic users (private and households), school users and for other public users (e.g markets and hospitals, communal users etc)
Finally disaggregate users that are provided with a Safely managed / Basic service / Limited service from the initiative. The initiative must tick all criteria to be considered as that service level.
1) Safely managed service:
- the initiative provides an improved sanitation facility (this includes: flush/pour flush to piped sewer system, septic tanks or pit latrines; ventilated improved pit latrines, composting toilets or pit latrines with slabs)
- the initiative's sanitation service is not shared with other households
- the initiative ensures that human excreta are safely disposed in situ or transported and treated off-site
2) Basic service:
- the initiative provides an improved sanitation facility (this includes: flush/pour flush to piped sewer system, septic tanks or pit latrines; ventilated improved pit latrines, composting toilets or pit latrines with slabs)
- the initiative's sanitation facility is not shared with other households
- initiative does not ensure that human excreta and urine is safely disposed / transported / treated
3) Limited service: Usually at baseline level, but cannot be included at target level. This includes, open pits, unimproved pit latrines, unlined pits, no slabs, prone to flooding etc
\* This is indicative of the reach and scale of the initiative in reaching new users with its products and services in terms of the service level that is being provided (as defined by JMP).

title.narrative: D1 - Total number of current unique users served by the initiative with sustainable access to improved and safe drinking water products and services

description.narrative:
Total nr of beneficiaries disaggregated by Male/Female and Domestic/school/public users
Please also check the criteria per service level to see what level best matches your initiative. The initiative must fulfill all criteria to be considered at that service level.
1. Safely managed service: 2. the initiative provides an improved source of water (this includes: piped water, boreholes or tube wells, protected dug wells, protected springs, rainwater, packaged / bottled water, water that is delivered) 3. the initiative is located on the premises of the household or dwelling 4. the initiative provides drinking water whenever it is needed 5. the drinking water provided by the initiative has no presence of E.coli 6. the drinking water provided by the initiative contains no / limited levels of arsenic and fluoride (below WHO standards: < 0.01 mg/L arsenic and < 1.5mg/L fluoride 7. Basic service: 8. the initiative provides an improved source of water (this includes: piped water, boreholes or tube wells, protected dug wells, protected springs, rainwater, packaged / bottled water, water that is delivered) 9. the initiative provides water for users where the collection time is less than 30 minutes for a roundtrip including queuing 0. Limited service:
Drinking water from an improved source for which collection time exceeds 30 minutes for a roundtrip including queuing.
1. Unimproved service:
Drinking water from an unprotected dug well or unprotected spring
\* This is indicative of the reach and scale of the initiative in reaching new users with its products and services in terms of the service level that is being provided (as defined by JMP).

title.narrative: D1E - Total number of current unique users served by the initiative with sustainable access to improved and safe drinking water products and services

description.narrative:
Total nr of beneficiaries disaggregated by Male/Female and Domestic/school/public users
Please also check the criteria per service level to see what level best matches your initiative. The initiative must fulfill all criteria to be considered at that service level.
1. Safely managed service:
- the initiative provides an improved source of water (this includes: piped water, boreholes or tube wells, protected dug wells, protected springs, rainwater, packaged / bottled water, water that is delivered)
- the initiative is located on the premises of the household or dwelling
- the initiative provides drinking water whenever it is needed
- the drinking water provided by the initiative has no presence of E.coli
- the drinking water provided by the initiative contains no / limited levels of arsenic and fluoride (below WHO standards: < 0.01 mg/L arsenic and < 1.5mg/L fluoride
2. Basic service:
- the initiative provides an improved source of water (this includes: piped water, boreholes or tube wells, protected dug wells, protected springs, rainwater, packaged / bottled water, water that is delivered)
- the initiative provides water for users where the collection time is less than 30 minutes for a roundtrip including queuing
3. Limited service:
Drinking water from an improved source for which collection time exceeds 30 minutes for a roundtrip including queuing.
4. Unimproved service:
Drinking water from an unprotected dug well or unprotected spring
\* This is indicative of the reach and scale of the initiative in reaching new users with its products and services in terms of the service level that is being provided (as defined by JMP).
